newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Overheated Russian shares take breather - traders.
newsitem.headline: Overheated Russian shares take breather - traders.

text.p: Leading Russian shares on Tuesday ticked down from Monday's record performance but traders said the temporarily overheated market could rise again by the end of the week.
"UES has been the locomotive of the past few weeks," said Sergei Sheikov, head of corporate securities at Raiffeisenbank.
"Today's falling off is a normal correction. I wouldn't worry too much -- the market is growing for now and you calmly can sit tight on your positions."
The Russian Trading System of 22 shares closed down at 353.99 on a thin $34.4 million total market turnover. The index closed at a record 360.72 on Monday.
National electricity company UES EESR.RTS ordinary shares slipped to $0.2975 from Monday's closing $0.3140, while preferred shares eased to $0.2000 from $0.2150.
Oil company Surgutneftegaz rose to $0.8800 from $0.8710 on Monday, but off a record $0.8950 during the day.

"I think overall the market will be tapping its feet until the beginning of summer around today's levels," said Creditanstalt senior trader Andrei Galperin. "There's still not enough money on the market to drive it up."
But MFK bank trader Dmitry Konov said prices could be marked up by the end of the week. "At these levels no one really actively sells," he said.
Traders said growth on Wall Street had investors jittery over what the Dow Jones would do next and was having an effect on the Russian market too.
"Everyone understands that any reaction on the American market will be reflected in all the others, including the Russian market," said Sheikov.
The Dow Jones industrial index closed at 7,293 on Monday, the latest of a series of record highs, but was off in midday trading on Tuesday.
Investors are also worried the U.S. Federal Reserve could consider raising interest rates at a meeting next week, traders said.
